title: Mourning Sampler, 1838
medium:
Medium: silk and human hair embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Mary Bechler's work made in Maytown in the year 1838
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser/ Martin. Purchased at Pottstown, Pennsylvania.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description:
A man and woman in black stand on either side of a tomb surmounted by an urn shaded by a weeping willow tree. The inscription on the tomb reads: 
Sacred to the memory of Elizabeth Moore who departed this life March the 7th, 1830 aged 32 years, six months and 28 days.

With a deep rose vine border at the top and sides, and the inscription. Human hair is used for the hair of the two figures.

tombstone.epitaph:
Mourning Sampler, 1838.
1838. Medium: silk and human hair embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered on plain weave foundation. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1974-100-31.
